course.subject: SOSC
course.name: China-United States Relations
course.description: China-US Relations is about interactions between the world's two most important countries. The more than two centuries' long history of the relationship is first elaborated. Consideration is then given to the key perennial conflictive issues on which conflict between China and the US, including economic issues, Taiwan, Tibet, human rights and arms-related questions. Many other areas of conflict and cooperation are also a focus of discussion, especially through student research papers and presentations. The analysis of China-US relations is carried out in the context of the effects the relationship has on the rest of the world.

reviews.author: vault34overseer
reviews.comment_content: 呢個課程雖然教嘅係中美關係,但係我會認為係讀國際關係嘅入門course.佢會由教你分析一段國際關係,講吓中美關係嘅歷史，宜家呢段關係之間嘅問題,亦都會講吓呢段關係嘅將來。你上完呢堂之後對分析國際局勢會有初步嘅掌握。
reviews.comment_teaching: 佢講哩就冇乜高低起伏,所以要keep住聽佢講嘢就都一啲難道，但佢有一樣嘢好,就係佢啲powerpoint極簡潔,內容啱啱好包曬個重點.而且佢有時會講吓當時發生緊嘅中美之間嘅大事,比如亞投行咁.佢係一個好有料嘅國際關係學者.
reviews.comment_grading:
出席率一成,midterm三成,final六成
但另外有optional assignment 畀你做,你肯做就有穩袋二成,有幾個option,有photo analysis, debate, analysis,同policy advocacy(最後因為debate太少人做所以加到三成),photo analysis同 debate係group做, analysis同policy advocacy就individual做.我就揀咗photo analysis.
要分析一幅同中美關係有關嘅相,揾佢所代表嘅事件同分析件事嘅性質
考試出mc加fill in the blank, midterm就mc多 , final就fill in the blank. 難道差唔多,都唔高
midterm 0.6個sd, final 1.7個sd, 加埋有做photo analysis最後A咗
reviews.comment_workload: 冇乜嘢做,係如果你想高分就一定要做optional assignment. 如果你唔想做嘅話其實好輕鬆. reading  我lap過但係只係增進課外知識,唔鐘意睇可以skip,對考試冇乜影響

reviews.author: 也許不必知道我是誰
reviews.comment_content:
Midterm之前先講1776年美國獨立
到1989年六四期間嘅中美關係
主要都係背歷史

Midterm之後就講1989年到而家
中美關係有咩挑戰
當然亦都有講到北韓 台灣呢啲左右大局嘅議題

課程算係幾全面
不過有啲位 特別係條約同人名比較難背
reviews.comment_teaching:
比較悶
雖然prof係有料到 好多嘢想教
但係每堂都係聽佢自己一個講足個幾鐘

ppt 雖然好簡潔
但係包唔晒佢上堂講嘅嘢 而呢啲內容考試都會考
所以如果想攞高分就要克服佢平淡嘅語調
盡量留心 抄下筆記咁
(我去到sem中間已經放棄 一係做自己嘢一係瞓覺 -,-)
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 30%
Final Exam 60%
Attendance 10%
(Optional Project 10%)

考試主要都係MC同填充題
讀熟ppt 應該可以保你above mean
但係要做top嗰堆
主要都係取決於ppt無嘅內容
同埋有無睇assigned reading
每次考試總有呢啲題目分高下

Optional project 種類算幾多
可以做issue/photo/book analysis
不過project presentation嘅內容 final exam都考.. - -

Midterm 18/30 (Mean: 17.4/30 SD: 4.4)
Final 44/60 (Mean: 36.4/60 SD: 7.4)
成個sem走咗一堂 無做project
最後B 都係唔算差嘅grading
reviews.comment_workload:
如果目標只係B range
其實考試前讀熟(真係要好熟)ppt 上齊堂就ok
唔需要做project

前面都講到
A range要求比較高 workload亦都會大

reviews.author: Rexsly
reviews.comment_content: The course is about China-US relations, so it covers some Chinese history and several current affairs between US and China, for instance human rights, economic aspect, Taiwan relation etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Barry's teaching is interesting, as he will teach the content with a more casual way, instead of just telling all content in ppt. He will include lots of extra information as well as his experience in researching about China foreign relation, so you won't be bored in class. Also his teaching pace is appropriate, as he will pause a little whenever he finishes a small part.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is okay. He claims that those who choose to write a paper usually get a higher grade than those who don't (which he mentions it in all courses he teach).
I chose only taking the exams and I got a B-, which a friend of mine who wrote a paper got a B. It is really easy for you to get a high grade, just revise well and pay attention to what he said in class.
reviews.comment_workload: The overall workload is quite light, depend on whether you choose to write a paper. The paper is totally voluntary and limited in numbers. If you choose to take the two MC exams only, what you need to do is just revise all ppts as well as the points he emphasised in class. There are also some reading materials and tutorials, which is also voluntary, but they are helpful for those who are interested in specific topics or preparing for exams.

reviews.author: ikplayer
reviews.comment_content:
A brief introduction about the relationship of China and US, in terms of economic, history and issue likes Tibet and human right.
The powerpoint provided not much useful in term of exam, it can only tell you which option is wrong.
reviews.comment_teaching: Most of the time just read what is on his notes which is a bit boring, but love to answer student question.
reviews.comment_grading:
50% mid-term and 50% Final exam if you don't choose to write an essay.
Exam format: all MC, no long question.
reviews.comment_workload:
Zero workload if you don't choose to write an essay.
Reading provided only for your own interest, nothing will be tested.

reviews.author: chengchingyu
reviews.comment_content:
Midterm: History of China from the Sino-Western connection, safety problem(nuclear weapons), econ relationships

Final: Human rights, Tibet, Taiwan issues
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mainly surrounding the PPTs, with his reading materials and personal experience.
In some lectures he will distribute the handouts about current pieces of news of the topic he is talking about.
reviews.comment_grading:
Two exams, one with 52 mc the other with 48mc.
No overlap content in two exams
I scored 68% in exams and got B+, didn't do the paper
Just remember to review those ppts before the exams
However, the questions are tricky, required you to analyse and link to other issues
So, although there are many mainland students, the highest is just about 80%
If you want to get A range, i think you must do the optional paper and presentation.
reviews.comment_workload:
No workload at all unless you write the paper
You can skip all the classes
The lecture vdo will be posted after lecture
However, PPTs are quite enough to support the exams.

reviews.author: ML
reviews.comment_content:
Course content is interesting and useful. Highly relevant to current news.
As I remembered, there were five topics and one was about Taiwan. Not sure if there is any updates but this course provides general idea about the tension and important treaties/agreements between the US and China.
reviews.comment_teaching:
All the contents are on the PPT so make sure you read and remember them before exam. No much extra content in the class.
The tutorial is interesting was well. Basically we engaged in some discussions and asked for clarification on some terms and issues.
reviews.comment_grading:
As long a you memorise the PPT you will be alright.
Prof could be subjective when grading papers so you better get some advice from him before deciding your topic.
reviews.comment_workload:
Basically there was no take home assignment.
For the workload, it totally depends on whether you get chance to write a paper and do presentation. Prof set a quota for the paper and then just do a lucky draw to select which groups could do it.
You could decide your paper topic so workload is also of your own decision.
Bare in mind that the Prof is quite subjective and could challenge you when grading papers but generally you get a better grade if you write it.
